text:
John A. Wilson Building 1350 Pennsylvania Avenue, NW, Washington, DC 20004 Phone: (202) 727-2643 Email: muriel.bowser@dc.gov Chief of Staff: Lindsey Parker City Administrator: Kevin Donahue Director of the Mayor's Office of Legal Counsel: Eugene Adams Senior Advisor: Beverly Perry Director of Mayor's Office of Community Affairs: Jackie Reyes-Yanes Scheduling Requests: mayor.dc.gov/page/invite-mayor September 6, 2024 Letter from the Mayor Dear Washingtonians, September is here, and that means its time to celebrate DCs vibrant creative spirit with 202Creates ! This month, were shining a spotlight on the artists, performers, and creators who fill our city with energy and culture. From concerts to film festivals, fashion shows to art installations, 202Creates is a
 tribute to the talent that makes DC the true creative capital. DCs creative scene isnt just about entertainment; its a driving force behind our citys growth and success. With a $13.8 billion creative economy,
 the arts are creating jobs, building community, and putting DC on the map as a global leader in innovation. We're proud that Marvel Studios makes superhero movies here, and that Oscar-nominated actors like Jeffrey Wright were born and raised in DC. And we're
 especially proud of the creatives who work in our schools and across DC Government and who have studios and businesses in DC. As we gather for events like Art All Night , Theatre Week and DC Fashion Week , H Street Festival and so many more, lets continue to support and uplift those who make DC the capital of creativity. I encourage everyone to explore the full calendar of 202Creates events at 202creates.com and find new ways to connect with our citys creative community. Sincerely, In This Week's Newsletter: Tomorrow: Afterschool in the City! Doggie Day Swim Register Now: DC Public Safety Job Fair #BeDowntown: The 15th Annual DC State Fair Tomorrow: Afterschool in the City! Explore the exciting opportunities at Learn24's After School in the City 2024, where District youth aged 5-21 can connect
 with afterschool and out-of-school time (OST) programs for the 2024-25 school year. Sponsored by the Office of the Deputy Mayor for Education and the Learn24 Network, this event offers families a chance to discover diverse learning experiences, jobs, internships,
 and more! When: Saturday, September 7 @ 11:00 a.m. Where : Deanwood Community Center, 1350 49th Street NE RSVP : learn24afterschoolinthecity2024.eventbrite.com Back to Top Doggie Day Swim Dive into the end of summer with your furry friends at the Department of Parks and Recreations (DPR) Doggie Day Swim!
 As the pool season wraps up, DPR is opening four pools just for the pups. Let your dog take a refreshing dip and splash around before we close the pools for the season. Dont miss this tail-wagging event! When : Saturday, September 7 @ 11:00 a.m. Where : Langdon Pool, Francis Pool, Ridge Road Pool, Upshur Pool Registration: doggiedayswimdc.splashthat.com Back to Top Register Now: DC Public Safety Job Fair Looking for an opportunity to make a difference in your community while advancing your career? Join the DC Public Safety Job Fair! This is a unique opportunity to meet and connect with representatives from a number
 of local public safety agencies. When : Friday, September 20 @ 11:00 a.m. Where : DC Armory, 2001 East Capitol Street SE RSVP HERE Back to Top #BeDowntown: The 15th Annual DC State Fair The DC State Fair is a free, family-friendly, daylong celebration of all things homegrown! Join for a celebration of the District's agricultural, culinary,
 and creative talents. Activities include a Kids Zone, local food and art vendors, and more! When : Saturday, September 7 @ 10:00 a.m. Where : Franklin Park, 1332 I Street NW More information: Find a schedule of events at dcstatefair.org Back to Top Mayor Muriel Bowser John A. Wilson Building | 1350 Pennsylvania Avenue, NW | Washington DC, 20004 (202) 727-2643 muriel.bowser@dc.gov | mayor.dc.gov | @mayorbowser STAY CONNECTED: Questions? Contact Us Help
